thread.title: Hundreds of People Gathered in L.A. to Protest Trump's Dakota Access and Keystone XL Pipeline Orders
thread.title_full: Hundreds of People Gathered in L.A. to Protest Trump's Dakota Access and Keystone XL Pipeline Orders

title: Hundreds of People Gathered in L.A. to Protest Trump's Dakota Access and Keystone XL Pipeline Orders
text:
Hundreds of People Gathered in L.A. to Protest Trump's Dakota Access and Keystone XL Pipeline Orders By Facebook PHOTO: MARK RALSTON 
An estimated 1,500 people gathered in downtown L.A. Sunday to protest President Donald Trump's executive orders fast-tracking the construction of the formerly-blocked Dakota Access and Keystone XL pipelines. 
The Dakota Access pipeline has been the subject of protests at Standing Rock that have lasted for months: activists say the pipeline's construction will desecrate land sacred to the Standing Rock Sioux tribe and that a leak would disrupt the water supply for 17 million people who drink from the Missouri River (which the pipeline would cross). Although then- President Barack Obama signed an executive order blocking its construction on December 4, Trump swiftly undid his work during his first week of office. Loading 
Rejected in November 2015 by the Obama administration, the Keystone XL pipeline had previously been under review for seven years. It would carry 800,000 barrels of oil daily from the Canadian oil sands to the Gulf Coast . Loading
